cards.name: Aegis Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.name: Because I Have Willed It
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
At the beginning of your opponents' end step, if they cast four or more spells this turn, abandon this scheme.

cards.flavor: Dwarves have an instinct for repair, an inherent understanding of how systems work, and a reputation for fearlessness. They're perfect candidates for the Fair's emergency response team.
cards.name: Aerial Responder
cards.text: Flying, vigilance, lifelink

cards.name: Behold My Grandeur
cards.text:
When you set this scheme in motion, add {U}{B}{R}.
When you set this scheme in motion, if you control six or more lands, you may search your library for a card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "Arise. You have been anointed by the light. Go forth and fight without fear, for you shall be victorious."
cards.name: Anointer of Champions
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bow to My Command
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
As you set this scheme in motion, choose an opponent.
Creatures the chosen player controls can't attack you or planeswalkers you control.
At the beginning of your opponents' end step, they may tap any number of untapped creatures they control with total power 8 or greater. If they do, abandon this scheme.

cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.name: Choose Your Demise
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, look at the top four cards of your library and separate them into a face-down pile and a face-up pile. An opponent chooses one of those piles. Put the cards in that pile into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: The demon had flown past the reach of Erebos's whip but not the point of the sun god's spear.
cards.name: Excoriate
cards.text: Exile target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: "Pain is a delusion of the weak. I'll demonstrate."
cards.name: Delight in the Hunt
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, create a 3/3 black Horror creature token and prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control this turn.

cards.name: Expedition Raptor
cards.text:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.flavor: "Let me unburden you of these fatuous hopes."
cards.name: Every Dream a Nightmare
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent discards a card. You draw a card for each land card discarded this way.

cards.flavor: His prowess gives the guildless hope that they can hold out against tyranny.
cards.name: Fencing Ace
cards.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.flavor: "My generosity blesses you all, even the undeserving."
cards.imageName: for each of you, a gift
cards.name: For Each of You, a Gift
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, for each opponent, create a 3/3 black Horror creature token that attacks that player each combat if able.

cards.name: Fiendslayer Paladin
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Fiendslayer Paladin can't be the target of black or red spells your opponents control.

cards.name: Know Evil
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, until your next turn, up to one target opponent can't attack with creatures, up to one target opponent can't cast creature spells, and up to one target opponent can't cast noncreature spells. You can't choose any player as a target more than once.

cards.flavor: Its wings disturb more than air.
cards.name: Flickerwisp
cards.text:
Flying
When Flickerwisp enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: "To think you've spent years honing your body only to die like this."
cards.name: Make Yourself Useful
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy target creature an opponent controls. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Gideon Jura
cards.text:
+2: During target opponent's next turn, creatures that player controls attack Gideon Jura if able.
−2: Destroy target tapped creature.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon Jura becomes a 6/6 Human Soldier creature that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Cry out for your comrades so that they
may join you in misery."
cards.name: The Mighty Will Fall
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, choose an opponent with the highest life total among your opponents. That player loses 7 life.

cards.flavor: "The essence of a lawful society is swift deterrence."
cards.name: Gideon's Lawkeeper
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: My Forces Are Innumerable
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
At the beginning of your end step, create a 3/3 black Horror creature token.
At the beginning of your opponents' end step, they may sacrifice two creatures. If they do, abandon this scheme.

cards.flavor: "Your superstitions and mumblings are useless chaff before my righteousness."
cards.name: Grand Abolisher
cards.text: During your turn, your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities of artifacts, creatures, or enchantments.

cards.flavor: "Groveling already? I'm just starting to enjoy myself."
cards.name: My Laughter Echoes
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Whenever you set a non-ongoing scheme in motion, you may abandon this scheme. If you do, set that scheme in motion again.

cards.flavor:
"There is power in abandon, but far more in control."
—Warden Hixus, to Kytheon
cards.name: Grasp of the Hieromancer
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "Whenever this creature attacks, tap target creature defending player controls."

cards.flavor: "Your companions were lucky to have died first."
cards.imageName: no one will hear your cries
cards.name: No One Will Hear Your Cries
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent chooses a creature they control, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Lightwielder Paladin
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Lightwielder Paladin deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target black or red permanent that player controls.

cards.name: Pay Tribute to Me
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent sacrifices a creature. If you control six or more lands, each opponent sacrifices another creature.

cards.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
cards.name: Mentor of the Meek
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Power Without Equal
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, draw three cards. You have no maximum hand size until your next turn. If you control six or more lands, you may cast up to three nonland cards from your hand without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."
cards.name: Moment of Heroism
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: "The gates open to my new era."
cards.name: A Reckoning Approaches
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, look at the top six cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: "Fear holds no place in faith's battle plan."
cards.name: Odric, Master Tactician
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Odric, Master Tactician and at least three other creatures attack, you choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.

cards.flavor: "The dunes smell spilled blood."
cards.name: There Is No Refuge
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, it deals 3 damage to up to one target creature. Create a 3/3 black Horror creature token.

cards.flavor: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."
cards.name: Precinct Captain
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.

cards.flavor: "Little insects, I have created entire worlds and extinguished twice as many."
cards.name: This World Belongs to Me
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, draw two cards. You may play an additional land this turn.

cards.flavor: Sometimes gestures of support are small. Sometimes not.
cards.name: Relief Captain
cards.text: When Relief Captain enters the battlefield, support 3. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to three other target creatures.)

cards.flavor: "Vow your allegiance to true power."
cards.name: What's Yours Is Now Mine
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of target creature an opponent controls and untap it.

cards.flavor:
"Sea Gate may have fallen, but we still stand. We still fight."
—Gideon Jura
cards.name: Shoulder to Shoulder
cards.text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Don't fret, infants. It wouldn't have worked anyway."
cards.name: When Will You Learn?
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent exiles the top card of their library. You may cast any number of nonland cards exiled this way without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor: A blazing sun that never sets.
cards.name: Sun Titan
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Sun Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may return target permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Idealism fits him better than his armor.
cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike

cards.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"
cards.name: Compulsive Research
cards.text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless they discard a land card.

cards.name: Icefall Regent
cards.text:
Flying
When Icefall Regent enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Icefall Regent.
Spells your opponents cast that target Icefall Regent cost {2} more to cast.

cards.text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a quest counter on Ior Ruin Expedition.
Remove three quest counters from Ior Ruin Expedition and sacrifice it: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Prognostic Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a card: Prognostic Sphinx gains hexproof until end of turn. Tap it.
Whenever Prognostic Sphinx attacks, scry 3. (Look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: Progress comes at a price.
cards.name: Reckless Scholar
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.

cards.name: Sphinx of Jwar Isle
cards.text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
You may look at the top card of your library. (You may do this at any time.)

cards.flavor: "I could see in the other mage's eyes that he'd thought of it too. Then it became a race to exploit the knowledge first."
cards.name: Vision Skeins
cards.text: Each player draws two cards.

cards.flavor:
"The best spot to hook one is right behind the gills."
—Rana Cloudwake, kor skyfisher
cards.name: Windrider Eel
cards.text:
Flying
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Windrider Eel gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Why would I kill you all? Who then would be left to worship me?"

cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each opponent's end step, that player chooses up to two creatures they control, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Deathbringer Regent
cards.text:
Flying
When Deathbringer Regent enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand and there are five or more other creatures on the battlefield, destroy all other creatures.

cards.flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.
cards.name: Doom Blade
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor:
"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud
cards.name: Harvester of Souls
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: Nightscape masters don't stop at raising the spirit of a fallen battlemage. They raise the flesh along with it.

cards.text:

{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.

cards.text:
Flying
When Overseer of the Damned enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature.
Whenever a nontoken creature an opponent controls dies, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.flavor: "The end is justified in being mean. Or something like that."
cards.name: Reckless Spite
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

cards.flavor: As they fought the Eldrazi, many vampires learned to live among humans. Others were unable to make the adjustment.
cards.name: Vampire Nighthawk

cards.text:
If an opponent controls seven or more lands, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
{R}: Avatar of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The shaman rattles not to inspire a battle fury but to drown out the shrieks of those fleeing the Eldrazi.
cards.name: Battle-Rattle Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have target creature get +2/+0 until end of turn.

Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.text:
+1: Chandra, Pyromaster deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker and 1 damage to up to one target creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls. That creature can't block this turn.
0: Exile the top card of your library. You may play it this turn.
−7: Exile the top ten cards of your library. Choose an instant or sorcery card exiled this way and copy it three times. You may cast the copies without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor: Chandra never believed in using her "inside voice."
cards.name: Chandra's Outrage
cards.text: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Whenever an opponent is dealt damage by a red instant or sorcery spell you control or by a red planeswalker you control, return Chandra's Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: It's hard to shout "Shields up!" with a javelin in your chest.
cards.name: Coordinated Assault
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "It has been my experience that disasters like to strike in pairs."
cards.name: Dualcaster Mage

Flash

cards.flavor:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay, captain of the Weatherlight
cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.
cards.name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
cards.text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: "Fools dig for water, corpses, or gold. The earth's real treasure is far deeper."
cards.name: Grim Lavamancer
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Grim Lavamancer deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: He wants to watch Ravnica burn, one soul at a time.
cards.name: Guttersnipe
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Hammerhand enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has haste. (It can attack and {T} no matter when it came under your control.)

cards.name: Inferno Titan
cards.text:
{R}: Inferno Titan gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Whenever Inferno Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.

cards.flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.
cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Obsidian Fireheart
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Put a blaze counter on target land without a blaze counter on it. For as long as that land has a blaze counter on it, it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, this land deals 1 damage to you." (The land continues to burn after Obsidian Fireheart has left the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: Sometimes you die a glorious death with your sword held high. Sometimes you're just target practice.
cards.name: Searing Spear
cards.text: Searing Spear deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

cards.flavor: Blood is holy to those whose god is War.

Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavor: In the Skyfang Mountains, one misstep can mean the end of an entire clan.

cards.text: Choose a color. Sudden Demise deals X damage to each creature of the chosen color.

{1}: Torchling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The common folk call it the breaking of the crust or the spilling of fire. Geomancers call it target practice."
—Ryda, geomancer
cards.name: Volcanic Geyser
cards.text: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to any target.

cards.flavor: All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
cards.name: Cultivate
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: An explorer's reward is a view of tomorrow's possibilities.

cards.text:
You may play an additional land this turn.
Draw a card.

{1}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches their library for a basic land card, puts it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffles their library.

cards.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.

cards.flavor: To be counted among the warriors of Setessa's Leina Tower, you must not fear death, only failure.
cards.name: Hunter's Prowess
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw that many cards."

cards.text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a quest counter on Khalni Heart Expedition.

+1: Target land you control becomes a 4/4 Elemental creature with trample. It's still a land.
+1: Untap up to four target Forests.

Trample

cards.flavor:
"Show your enemies as much mercy as they would show you."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller
cards.name: Press the Advantage
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"When the land is angry, so are they."
—Nissa Revane

Trample

"Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

Enchant land

cards.flavor: "The most elegant solutions are found in nature. You just have to know where to look."
cards.name: Vines of the Recluse
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+2 and gains reach until end of turn. Untap it. (A creature with reach can block creatures with flying.)
